properties.name: Acropolis at, Athens, Greece
properties.description: Posted by Wondersteam  Athens,Greece

properties.name: Anchorage, Alaska
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeAnchorage, AlaskaAnchorage is Alaska\'s largest city and the starting off point for traveling north to Denai National Park, Fairbanks, etc., and south to the beautiful rainforests of the Kenai Peninsula. Last visited in 2004, but headed back in August, 2006, for the Inside Passage cruise.

properties.name: Athens, Greece
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeAthens, GreeceMy first, but I hope not my last, trip to Greece was May, 1990. The Acropolis at dusk, peering through the closed gates up at the Parthanon, was a magical moment.

properties.name: Bangkok, Thailand
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeBangkok, ThailandCapital city of Thailand with a population of approximately 10 million, 10% of the country\'s population. Buddhism is the primary religion, and the city has many temples to visit. "Thailand" means "Land of the Free" and was previously known as Siam. Take an overnight train south to fabulous beaches, including Ko Samui.

properties.name: Dharmasala, India
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeDharmasala, IndiaIn the foothills of the Himalayas, in the Indian state of Himachel Pradesh, it is the location of the Tibetan Government in Exile and the home of the Dalai Lama. So much to see and enjoy, especially the temples and the library that houses many Tibetan books and manuscripts.

properties.name: Fairbanks, Alaska
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeFairbanks, AlaskaVisited in August, 2004, in the height of the forest fire season, hence, breathing was a challenge. Spent an evening at the home of the first woman Iditerod racer who lives with her huskies 20 miles out of town. Nice venture for a dog person especially.

properties.name: Havana, Cuba
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeHavana, CubaBeautiful city, the most delicious papaya, and the friendliest people in the world!

properties.name: Hawaii
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeHawaiiOahu (1975), Maui (2003), and The Big Island (2003). Each time I try to maintain the Island spirit when I return to the mainland, and each time it slips away before I know it, but that\'s just reason to keep returning. I think the Hawaiian languaage is the most beautiful in the world!

properties.name: Hyderabad,India
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeHyderabad, IndiaCapital city of the state of Andra Pradesh on the Deccan Plateau. It is India\'s 5th largest city with a population of over 6 million. My 6-month fellowship at the American Studies Research Center there was the beginning of a life-long love and fascination with India

properties.name: Kamakura, Japan
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeKamakura, JapanLovely coastal town 2 hours by train south of Tokyo where my friend Maya lives. Nice beach too but beware of the jellyfish. Visit the big Buddha and the aquatic museum (where you can safely see many jellyfish) and eat fantastic sushi.

properties.name: Koyasan, Japan
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeKoyasan, JapanKoyasan is a beautiful mountain site of Buddhist temples located between Osaka and Nara, accessible by train. Arrangements can be made to stay in one of the temples. One of the most peaceful places I\'ve ever been.

properties.name: Lima, Peru
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeLima, PeruPeru\'s largest city, approximately 6.9 million. It is coastal, dry and relatively mild climate. You can drive up into the Andes to approximately 12,000 ft. Last visit was in 1982.

properties.name: Mexico City
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeMexico City, Mexico

properties.name: New Delhi, India
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeNew Delhi, IndiaBig, busling, smoggy city with lots to see, hear, smell. Visit the Red Fort, of course, the Gandhi Museum, The American Library, and lots more.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeParis, FranceCapital city of France, population over 2 million with over 9 million in urban area. Last visited in 1990 where I was "saved" by being with my French-speaking daughter, Leslie.

properties.name: Savannah, Georgia
properties.description: Posted by Phaysee23 W. Broad Street, Savannah, GeorgiaMy birthplace: 23 W. Broad St., Savannah.

properties.name: Strasbourg, France
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeStrasburg, FranceLeslie and I spent a week-end there in April, 1990. Unbelieveley clean and neat after 6 months in India.

properties.name: Stratford, Ontario, Canada
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeStratford, Ontario, CanadaCanada\'s center for Shakespeare. Haven\'t been there for decades but fondly remembered for the first time I saw "A Midsummer Night\'s Dream."

properties.name: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
properties.description: Posted by PhayseeOur home, Feb. 1975 through June 1977, right on the edge of the Endowment Lands that reached all the way to the campus of the University of British Columbia, my alma mater
